docs.snippet: Five runners from South Africa, whose athletes are barred from competing in United States amateur competition, have entered the Boston Marathon by claiming they are American or Rhodesian.
docs.lead_paragraph: Five runners from South Africa, whose athletes are barred from competing in United States amateur competition, have entered the Boston Marathon by claiming they are American or Rhodesian.
docs.abstract: South African runners Johnny Halberstadt, Willie Farrell, Brian Chamberlain, Bernard Rose and Kevin Shaw have entered Boston Marathon by claiming they are Amer or Rhodesian; S African athletes are barred from competing in US amateur competition (S)

headline.main: S. African Runners Use Ploy; I.A.A.F. Bars South Africa

docs.snippet: MONTIVIDEO, Uruguay, April 7 (UPI)--The International Olympic Committee voted today, 36-28, to recognize China while at the same time retaining Taiwan as a member.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTIVIDEO, Uruguay, April 7 (UPI)--The International Olympic Committee voted today, 36-28, to recognize China while at the same time retaining Taiwan as a member.
docs.abstract: Internatl Olympic Com votes to recognize China while at same time retain Taiwan as member; Chinese Olympic Com calls resolution 'not acceptable' but stops short of rejecting it outright (M)

docs.snippet: They said the jig was up for Easter bonnets. Only a dumb bunny would wear one, they said. But what did they know? This week, for the first time in ages, a number of bright young women were seen buying what once was called an Easter bonnet, not that...
docs.lead_paragraph: They said the jig was up for Easter bonnets. Only a dumb bunny would wear one, they said. But what did they know? This week, for the first time in ages, a number of bright young women were seen buying what once was called an Easter bonnet, not that they would use the term.

headline.main: A New Easter Bonnet: No Restrictions Upon It; The Youthful Viewpoint Differing Opinions With Antique Dresses

docs.snippet: Eugene List is at it again. On the evening of May 2 he will be the guide through a "monster art" in Carnegie Hall devoted mostly to the music of Louis Moresu Gottschalk. It will be the 150th anniversary, almost to the day of the American compos  er's...
docs.lead_paragraph: Eugene List is at it again. On the evening of May 2 he will be the guide through a "monster art" in Carnegie Hall devoted mostly to the music of Louis Moresu Gottschalk. It will be the 150th anniversary, almost to the day of the American compos er's birth; he was born in New Orleans on May 8, 1829, and ...

headline.main: MUSIC VIEW; Gottschalk's Monster Concert MUSIC VIEW

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 29 (Reuters)  An estimated 20 million illegal abortions are performed in the world each year and are a leading cause of death among women of child-bearing age, a study issued today said.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 29 (Reuters) An estimated 20 million illegal abortions are performed in the world each year and are a leading cause of death among women of child-bearing age, a study issued today said.
docs.abstract: Population Crisis Com repts that estimated 20 million illegal abortions are performed in world each yr and are leading cause of death among women of child-bearing age; also notes that another 20 million abortion are self-induced annually and number is growing (M)

headline.main: Rate of Illegal Abortions Placed At 20 Million a Year Worldwide; Increase Is Expected Differences in Age Cited
Other Ideas & Trends; Abortion Statistics Hodgkin's Disease Doubts Busing the Handicapped Backhanded Compliment

docs.snippet: QUITO, Ecuador--The military in this tiny nation took a significant step in its planned retreat from governmental responsibility last week and earned the right to head up the column of brass hats in eight countries who are heading back to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: QUITO, Ecuador--The military in this tiny nation took a significant step in its planned retreat from governmental responsibility last week and earned the right to head up the column of brass hats in eight countries who are heading back to the barracks.

headline.main: Ecuador Goes Civilian and More Prepare To Follow

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 6--A steady decline in Chile's birth rate during the last five years of economic hardship has resulted in a campaign against birth control.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 6--A steady decline in Chile's birth rate during the last five years of economic hardship has resulted in a campaign against birth control.
docs.abstract: Steady decline in Chile's birth rate during last 5 years of economic hardship has resulted in campaign against birth control; newspaper El Mercurio article reports change in official policy on family planning designed to promote population growth; Health Ministry recently published figures showing that birth rate remained at about 28 for each thousand people between '69 and '73, but declined sharply after that to 21.6 a thousand in '78; decline coincides with military regime of Pres Augusto Pinochet, which took power in Sept '73 (M)

headline.main: CHILEANS, IN CHANGE, OPPOSE BIRTH CURBS; A Steady Decline in the Birth Rate Since the Military's Takeover Prompts a Shift in Policy

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: 7 South Korean reporters are convicted of privately publishing and circulating news items banned under '75 emergency decree that outlaws criticizing Government and spreading rumors harmful to it; reporters were dismissed by newspaper Dong-A Ilbo 4...
docs.abstract: 7 South Korean reporters are convicted of privately publishing and circulating news items banned under '75 emergency decree that outlaws criticizing Government and spreading rumors harmful to it; reporters were dismissed by newspaper Dong-A Ilbo 4 years ago after demanding press freedoms (S)

headline.main: World News Briefs; 7 South Korean Reporters Sentenced for Violating Ban
